content.label: So I have been playing this game for quite a while and I just got to the desert ruin puzzles and I was so clueless as to what to do. Then I looked it up and it said that it is all about physical orientation and lighting. So then I go back to the game and I move around and I get the first one and then after that I could barely see anything with the light reflecting puzzles. So for those I had to just keep guessing until I got up to one of  the puzzles. I was so confused because that was about secret patterns through lighting and I could not see anything. One solution would be too put little spots on the ground so we know where to look or make us be able to see the pattern at a wider angle. Otherwise it is a good game with fun puzzles (not desert ruins) and it makes me use my brain a lot. For ten dollars this game should really have no issues and developers should fix any problems on the reviews (not saying you have to answer mine immediately). I hope this gets fixed.

If you like playing the same type of puzzle over and over again then this is the game for you. But there are no instructions, no clues, you are playing the game blind. Also all your work amounts to nothing, don‚Äôt expect any sort of story line or any sort of big ending. Their are no explanations during the game or at the end. Major disappointment for all the rave review it has.
Total rip off.  Purchased this for $9.99.  The game consists of repetitive walking into walls and tracing lines on a grid.  There is no progress, just monotony.  Do not waste your money!

I am honestly not into repetitive puzzle game, and The Witness looks just like that, at first. The game starts out slow, presenting a segment of the world I am in where board-like puzzles are everywhere and solving them is absolutely crucial to advance. I wasn‚Äôt thrilled when my first impression was that it‚Äôs going to be like solving these puzzles in a beautiful park for the entire game.

However, things start to impress me once I get to explore how vast, how mysterious, and how eye-poppingly beautiful the whole island is. There are moments I even think to myself, after seeing all kinds of beautifully created locations that I know a lot of love has been put into, that even just ‚Äúsightseeing‚Äù around the entire island alone is already worth the money.

Once I get intrigued by the beauty of the island, the puzzles become the reward of what I get to see and explore further. The story also unfolds slowly. The best part is: I have now come to love these board puzzles, for its ever-evolving nature throughout the game, and its cleverness put into them.

This is not a game to binge, to play it all in one sitting. It‚Äôs a game to take it slow. Play it now and then. Solve some puzzles, walk around, enjoy Einstein‚Äôs quotes dubbed by an electrifying voice, and then put the game down for a while. Do that for a few days, and I can guarantee that you will walk away with something you love about this game.

The graphics are fine but the puzzles are all the same. In general the game is boring and frustrating, not an immersive experience like you‚Äôd get from a myst-type game. The sound is nothing to write home about. Not worth $10, and not worth my time.

It's not often that you find a game this, well, different. I've played this game through twice now, and I'm still not bored. Graphics are beautiful, sound is amazing, and the puzzles are exactly how they should be. Frustrating. The game does a great job of letting you figure out how each puzzle is solved. I've never played a game as great as this one, and I have absolutely no complaints. This game is worth every cent of the price.
Follow this amazing game since it launched,now I'm glad to see the witness on AppStore!

A game with mysterious puzzles that can't be solved easily.  Requires too much time and effort with no rewards in terms of entertainment.  I have other things to do and other rewarding games to play in my limited spare time.  Give it a pass.

The game itself is amazing and immersive, but is hampered by the controls. There needs to be some sort of control stick to make it a much more smooth experience. At least an option to switch from the normal controls into a control stick for walking/running and dragging for camera.
Repetitive, ugly, and pointless. Would like my money back please.

Colossal waste of time!  If you enjoy tracing your finger through random puzzles using trial-and-error with no apparent outcome, then you will love this game.  If you don‚Äôt have a job, or friends, or a family, then you will love this game.  If you enjoy an activity with as much productivity as punching your grandma in the face, then you will love this game.  I would rather have given $9.99 to white supremicists than to the makers of this game!
Tedious, slow, boring, horrible, if there was a zero star option I would pick it.

This game has a lot of 5 star qualities. The pros: The map for one is huge and wandering around is fun. Stumbling on to new puzzles is exciting. And periodically you get some interesting information on the story line. The graphics are pretty good for an iPhone game. Not great, but still pretty cool. The amount of puzzles in the game is staggering. Those are all the positives. 
The cons: this game is aggravating. I consider myself to be good at puzzles and pretty smart and I have a rough time with many of them. To the point where I had to start relying on walk throughs to help me. And in some cases the puzzles are so annoying they almost make you give up on the game. There are also environmental puzzles that are freaking impossible to find or do unless you have a walk through. I don't think a single person can do this game on their own. It's also very tedious at times and all of the puzzles are nearly the same. It gets old after a while. Honestly if it wasn't for my stubbornness I would quit. So, it has its good qualities and it's bad. Sometimes I wonder if it's worth all the hassle if I'm not really having fun. The discovering part is really fun but the puzzles are so tedious and boring. Once I finish the game I'll update this review.
I dearly thank every spirit involved with this creation.

This is a lovely game on any platform, but I think it really achieves its ideal state on the iPad. Beware: despite its cartoonish and highly stylized look, some of the puzzles are quite difficult. This isn‚Äôt a game for puzzle sissies.
Please add more control options it nearly breaks the game for me joystick control could make this game much smoother to play

I am nowhere near finished, but have already gotten my money‚Äôs worth. This is what Myst was trying to be. You can walk anywhere unless there‚Äôs a physical barrier in your way. Total freedom of movement!  Lots to investigate, and some ‚Äúoh wow ‚Äú moments. Take your time. Walk away if you‚Äôre stuck. The only thing I‚Äôd change is the voice recordings; would much rather read the quotes - call them up on a screen maybe.

Sure the visuals are stunning but the fanciful backdrop is merely a setting for dozens of ‚Äòfinger-maze‚Äô puzzles. There‚Äôs very little variety here. I‚Äôm sure without the setting this boring game wouldn‚Äôt have garnered all the hype.

title.label: Great but not so battery friendly

content.label:
Din‚Äôt play if your charger isn‚Äôt nearby...
15 mins of play takes 40% battery on iPhone 6s

This is a great great game and very well suited for mobile. It reminds me of the Talos Principle, which I absolutely adore but which is also significantly less well suited for mobile (I played the desktop version).  A beautiful little world to explore with a surprisingly mind bending assortment of puzzles all based around a very simple core concept. Just great puzzle design.

Many games these days brag about being procedurally generated, so the content is always changing. Not this game. Every inch of this island has been carefully constructed, designed to serve a larger purpose. It is expansive, gorgeous, and mysterious. It is rich with wonder. You will want to live on this island forever to discover all of its secrets. You will accomplish things you at first thought impossible. You will feel like a genius and like a fool. You will feel something inside yourself begin to open, to expand. There is more to you than you know.

Just 3 hour game play drained my iPad Pro battery from 100% to 25%!!
Unbelievable!!
Down is up and up is down. Please add this or I will get a refund. Thanksüëåüèº
Literally everything I want in a game

title.label: Well that was a waste of money

content.label:
I played for a bit, even though I was immediately turned off how all the puzzles were essentially just a maze with some minor mechanism changes. 

I stopped playing abruptly when I get to the guess where it goes puzzles.  Find the right path in a tree of 16, then go to the next.  Guess wrong in the next one, go back to the first.  Finally get the 2nd right, start guessing the 3rd.  Guess wrong, and go back and do the 2nd again.  

That is not fun, just an annoying waste of time.

I haven‚Äôt played a game....on a console, on my iPad, ever...that has totally captivated me like this has. You gradually learn the language of the puzzles/mazes, and towards the end it challenges the toughest. Along the way there‚Äôs a number of lessons to be learned...both overtly from audio logs and videos, as well as more subtlety from the surrounding environment. I‚Äôm thoroughly impressed, and now that I‚Äôve finished (after a couple weeks) I hope there‚Äôs a version 2 on the horizon.
This game is basically unplayable on an iPhone X. It‚Äôs incredibly dizzying and the controls are janky. I would like a refund.

Normally I like tense difficult games, but this provides an immersive relaxing experience I am enjoying a lot. I don‚Äôt play puzzlers because the puzzles lack coherent logic behind their solutions, that a ha moment.  But these puzzles are very coherent and it rewards you for thinking intelligently, but not in a way where you are overanalyzing everything. And it rewards you for wandering, looking, tinkering, and I find how often the game pats you on the back so satisfying. There are secret videos that absolutely make the searching for answers so gratifying. I recommend this to lovers of world wandering and puzzle solving.  And it is worth the money because it is a deep enriching, very long game.

I have been obsessively playing this game for over 6 weeks now.  This addiction started slowly.  The first few days I wasn‚Äôt sure it was worth my time and money.  But the more I explored, and discovered, and solved, I realized I was wrong.  This is one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played.

The more I played, the more I was in awe of the developers imagination and implementation.  I can remember a few OMG moments in games I‚Äôve played over the years:  In Myst when I suddenly found myself on a completely different island for the first time; in Obsidian when I realized I was working my way around the inside walls of a cube.  And in The Witness, after playing for a month, all of a sudden I saw another completely different aspect of the game.  It was there all along, I just hadn‚Äôt noticed it yet.  Wow!

This is a game for explorers and puzzle solvers.  It takes a person with patience, a hunger for discovery, and lots of perseverance.  If that is you, this game will reward you with daily surprises and delights.

I finished it today‚Äîwell, I got to an end.  But I haven‚Äôt solved everything, so I‚Äôm not really finished.  There are messages still to find.  I can see places I haven‚Äôt explored yet (a door to an unexplored room is locked from the inside, for instance).  So I am continuing to explore, in hopes I can discover more.

I‚Äôm running iOS 11.2 on a first gen iPad Pro and the battery still gets destroyed. Please work on the battery consumption issues! I have to stop playing the game, which is unfortunate because the game itself is wonderful.
I‚Äôm new to gaming and therefore very slow. When I found that my last game wasn‚Äôt properly saved and I had to start quite a few steps behind I gave it up.

title.label: The game itself is good but plotting this on phone is not ok

content.label:
Tried once on pc version, much easier to control. Phone version is just too difficult to control motion (walk, puzzle solving (despite my finger size))
Not satisfied with 10$ worth mobile game.

Where‚Äôs the gorgeous graphics? Stop kidding me, graphics are at PS2 level. Same puzzles over and over again, sounds boring? You bet! Only new feature this game introduces is that you control the character using touch controls, which you can imagine is $#@*[ compared to even a simple PS2 controller.

title.label: No way to report an issue, so...

content.label:
‚ÄúSupport website‚Äù provides no support, so I‚Äôm forced to complain through the review forum:

The rail line environmental puzzle in the Quarry is broken on the iPhone 7 Plus. I flat out can‚Äôt drag the line along the track (I can activate the start and a short length of the line, but as the elevator lowers, I can‚Äôt drag the line any further). Please fix.

[Update] The puzzle works, but you have to back-track your line (back to the start) and extend it again at the point when you can extend it beyond the initial length... agitating, considering it‚Äôs slow moving to test the puzzle over and over again. Not game breaking, but could still use a fix/optimization.

No instructions. 

I want a refund. Not worth $10.00.

I adore this game! It would be a complete 5 stars from me if it weren‚Äôt for the controls. I hope the developers make an update where the controls are similar to a first-person shooter set up. Where the left side controls movement and the right side controls the direction you are looking. The controls that are set currently make it very difficult to navigate tight corners or get to an area quickly under time constraints. Please update the controls!!!

I love the gameplay and am slightly addicted. However, its currently unplayable because the game crashes when I reach a certain area of the map, which is also where I need to go in order to progress any further. So I cannot play until fixed via update. Please update soon! Playing on iPhone X.

It had potential, however the developers must have been either drunk, high, spent too much time in philosophy classes, or simply mentally ill. The recordings and videos discussing mainly god, wine, glass and encouraging the listener not to look for things in this level of a game where you are required to look for things, were purely waste of time that a listener will never get back. Developers, why did you bring religion into your game? Gamers do not waste your time with the recordings and the videos. The puzzles were primitive and some did not follow their own logic. A lot of time is lost by simply moving from area to area. I was working on both the main puzzle and the hidden puzzles, however, after taking the ridiculous flying elevator ride, where you were told it was just a dream, it erased my game progress and took me back to the beginning. (Spoiler alert: the flying elevator is the game‚Äôs end point, without any warning). There is no way to save the game on the iPad Pro in the settings. It is all gone, as if I have never played it - frustrating. The graphics are mediocre at the best, somewhat outdated. The game was definitely not designed by anyone with the knowledge of modern gaming technology. I was hoping for something more intellectual and entertaining and this game definitely missed the mark. Can you call shadows a puzzle? Drawing of simple figures on a grid resembled the basic computer programming- sad. Not much of a puzzle. Furthermore, what is with the shape of the hidden puzzles? Head and the tail. How is finding a repetitious shape a puzzle? Not to mention, the bird pitch sounds. How are the bird sounds a puzzle? Do you warn hearing impaired people that they will not be able to solve the bamboo forest and an area in the hedge maze without being able to hear? Disappointing and primitive. Why is this game recommended by Apple?

Literally, the way this game moves around the screen makes me feel very ill. My stomach heaves. I‚Äôve tried to play it several times and within minutes I‚Äôm in bathroom.  I have no explanation that I am photo sensitive. I‚Äôve never been affected by a game this way but I think the problem is 85% me and there‚Äôs something in the game programming that maybe different from what my brain can handle.

Great game, awful controls. Loved it on PlayStation was very excited to get on iPhone but omg the controls are awful. Why not just have virtual joystick? The push to walk is very annoying and makes the game frustrating.
Vsbajsj

title.label: A great game fettered by the terrible interface

content.label: This is a beautiful game but in the mobile version there is a large bar covering the top left corner of the screen for the entire game and beams of light that spawn whenever I try to move. Neither of them are actually necessary for the game and should be adjustable in the settings. The light beam to show you where you are going sorta makes since but the bar on the top left to access settings.... what were you thinking!!!!
Apple likes this game enough to give it game of the year. I hated it enough to attempt to warn people not to waste 10 bucks. It has nice graphics, but that is it. Don‚Äôt waste your money

title.label: What a PRETENTIOUS piece of garbage

content.label:
So I LITERALLY spend a month figuring out and solving some of the most infuriating and illogical puzzles only to get an ending that spouts wanna-be smart phrases because the devs want you to know ‚Äòhow smart they are‚Äô...and of course, the ending takes you right back to the beginning where you lose ALL your progress when you were planning on trying for 100% completion and discovering a cave challenge that someone told me about...but WHY would I go through all that BS again????...oh, and that secret ‚Äòending‚Äô is seriously a special kind of stupid pretentious drivel...

Yes, devs and creator whatever the heck your name is: you‚Äôre are sooo clearly smarter than the rest of us...‚Äùanyone who uses a guide to complete 1 puzzle is ruining the experience for themselves‚Äù - creator of ‚Äòthe witness‚Äô....well that‚Äôs some straight up BULL cause I wish I had used a guide for the extra hard puzzles that took me days to figure out because I am so angry with this game and poor execution

Nothing but something pretty to look at...not worth $10...go to a real art museum and see REAL ART....not this garbage game...or go buy ‚ÄòFlower‚Äô...an artful game with FUN gameplay mechanics that reward you in the end

Can you tell I‚Äôm angry?? Yea thanks for adding this game to your App Store, Apple....god I wish I never purchased and played this..

Update: WHAT A JOKE this game won ‚Äúbest game of 2017 on iPad‚Äù...firstly, this game came out on pc and consoles....secondly, it‚Äôs highly pretentious and overrated (just look at overall score of 3.9)...‚Äôsplitter critters‚Äô DESERVED its award as it did something unique and was a mobile exclusive...shame on you again Apple, for not picking a more deserving game over the witness (aka the pretentiousness)...the TALOS PRINCIPLE is LEAGUES better in puzzle design, graphics, actual intelligence, etc. (if you are going to still go with a game that was on pc first)

The people that write bad reviews just don't understand this game. Plain and simple, this game is art. And with a forty dollar console price, spending the 10 for this version is a no brainer. And trust me, you get your money's worth, this is one tough game, but so worth it! Buy this game!

I fell for the ‚ÄúBest Game of 2017‚Äù, when I believe they meant ‚ÄúBest Lame Game of 2017‚Äù.  There are no instructions, no story line, no help section and no clues for when you get stumped.  I guess I'm asking too much from a $10 game.  I am only a few lame puzzles into the game and I'm stumped at what they want me to do.  This is the worst game I have EVER attempted to play!
Beautiful game with gorgeous environments and engaging puzzles. This one will make you stop and think while you explore the island. Highly recommended!

The best part of the game by far is the ability to wander through a gorgeous island and uncover incredible puzzles. This would have been an A+ game if the puzzles were more varied, not the same trace a line on a screen. They became more difficult and almost impossible, but were still the same type of puzzle. Do that for 20% or even 40% of the game but incorporate completely different types of puzzle tasks as well. I got bored doing the same thing.  I had to bump my rating up a notch for the enlightening movie film clips. Brilliant. The cave was a delight as well. 
I will hope to see a Witness 2 with varied tasks and puzzles. I am a fan forever.

title.label: Great Game! Latest Updated fixed all problems with saved games!

content.label: Thank you, Thekla for your response and for fixing the problem with loading saved games! I am through 6 lasers now able to give this game a 5 star rating. Haven‚Äôt seen a glitch with saved games since the latest update.  The interface is good and the puzzles are challenging.  I am really enjoying this game!  Thanks!
